caption: Excellent, friendly service and great food. I ordered togarashi steak, yukke toro, and kanpachi sashimi. the seven spice sauce on the togarashi was totally unique and really good, savory and complex, and the steak and asparagus were cooked perfectly. the yukke toro was a new experience for me—the raw egg and tuna came in a cup with seaweed on the side to make little rolled bites. the smoked soy sauce complement the tuna very well.  There was a mixup with one of the items in my order that extended my wait time, and the owner personally apologized and comped the item.l and gave me a drink for free. Her friendliness and commitment to excellent customer experience more than made up for the delay. While waiting I also noticed how friendly the wait staff was with customers and how many regulars seem to frequent the restaurant.  Overall very worth the price point for a fine dining experience—it felt fancy even in the form of takeout at home! I can’t wait till later this year when dining indoors is fully possible again. I will definitely visit then, and order takeout in the meantime!
So good. The service was impeccable and the food was the best. Definitely a return visit to come. Thank you.
Always wonderful. Get the Kani nigiri and the togarashi shrimp. You will never go wrong with either.

The maki spicy tuna roll was okay, it didn’t seem to have mayo but did have green onion inside. The shishito peppers we spicy and more on the raw side lightly battered. I wish they came with a sauce but I used soy sauce which was good. They give you a lot of peppers so that was nice.  The maki sweet potato roll was only good because I asked for eel sauce other than that is was tough to eat. The miso soup was great! I don’t think I would come here again as I did not enjoy the maki rolls with seaweed on the outside.

This is my favorite sushi restaurant in the Chicagoland area. The food here is amazing, but my favorite dish is the chicken togarashi (if you get this, make sure to pour the sauce over the rice after eating the chicken-you'll thank me later). Some of my other favorites here are the Tuna Tuna salmon role and the Kani Nigiri. And that is just the food. My favorite thing about this restaurant is the service. The servers here know me by name, greet me when I come in the restaurant, and know what I would like to order. This is a fantastic restaurant!
Friendly staff. But we waiting nearly 50mins for our food. Semi expensive and small portions. I was hungry when I got there, and left hungry.
Food was absolutely delicious.  As someone who studied abroad in Japan, it's nice when the food at japanese restaurants is how you remember back in Japan. Excellent service as well.
I actually enjoyed the dishes and customer service, great area very close to my house. The employees are always very friendly. Highly recommended.
We had a wonderful experience in this place. We loved the superb ambience and the menu. The waiters were super amiable. I am content we eventually decided to visit this restaurant.

This is easily the worst "sushi" restaurant I've been too. My date and I had wondered why this place was so empty compared to the rest on this bustling street. We soon had our answer. Despite being four pages, the menu had only 4 "chef" rolls to choose from and an unusually wide variety of Maki rolls. Willing to give it a go we went with the nights special (a tuna tempura roll) a shrimp tempura roll and a "Japanese sweet potato roll" which neither of us has ever heard of. First they brought the rolls out when they were ready and not all together. The "special" roll was miserable. Nothing more than a standard spicy tuna roll that was apparently deep friend and then drowned in a spicy sauce. It was soggy and tasteless. The shrimp tempura was covered in HORSERADISH SAUCE. Who does that? The sweet potato roll was just add. Salty fried potato wrapped in rice.  I cannot speak to the rest of the menu but nothing I had was good. The only redeeming quality was that this place *looked* nice. Great ambiance and mood. But dont let that facade draw you in like a moth to a flame; you will only get burned.
Good food and atmosphere but a little pricey
(Translated by Google) Great avocado maki  (Original) Great avocado maki
Very fresh and tasty Sushi
Great food, great atmosphere
The best sushi in town!
Excellent food, very nice employees, constantly  awesome mood. They charge reasonable prices and the food quality is very good. Great work.
Good delicious sushi
One of the best sushi places you can go and definitely the best in Chicago. It's expensive but well worth the cost. From friendly service to amazing fish this place truly satisfies the soul.
Definitely one of my go to sushi spots in Wicker Park. The staff rocks. Sushi always on point. Everything taste amazing.
Salmon melts in your mouth. Wild caught salmon taste not farmed. Tuna tuna Salmon and spicy mono are to die for. Great drinks too.
BEST sushi!  Recently returned after a 7 year absence - service and food remain top quality.  Highly recommend the hamachi and saketini.
Great service and food! I’m in love with the restaurant vibe!
One of my favorite places. Unique food
All around pretty good place and drinks are made good as well
Exelent service and high quality food
Best high-end sushi in wicker park
The  food was excellent !!!
Wonderful food and top notch service.
Legitimately some of the best sushi in the city! Go here!
Fish is fresh and delicious.  Excellent service.
The chicken togarashi is amazing!
Great sushi.
An incredibly enjoyable restaurant with warm ambience and many delicious flavors found in the many dishes.
Absolutely excellent. Friendly staff, great food!
Good food
Pricey for such small portions. And way too loud.
It was way too expensive for how mediocre all the food tasted, and the portions are barely there. Combined with the very low light we had to work to spot my husband's dinner
Great sushi. Nice ambiance

Good fish- I had the otoro and the yukke toro which were both delicate and tasty, and we tried their chicken togarashi which was also quite good. It's expensive but that's expected with good sushi. Service is also good.
Excellent! The sushi is the best in the city. And the togarashl sause amazing. New item tonight was Fillet mignon togarashl; it was awesome.
Spicy Mono and Kani Nagiri are my favorites!!

I'm no stranger to paying a premium for especially good food, but Mirai just wasn't especially good. The prices are astronomical and the sushi is average to above average. It's certainly not a bad place, but it gets two stars because Chicago is so full of other places you can go to get comparable or better sushi for cheaper.  The service was good and the food was certainly not bad, which is why it gets two stars and not one. Certainly if budget isn't at all a concern for you then I wouldn't scream for you to avoid Mirai. I just can't justify going back given the number of other great options I have.
Best sushi i have ever had
The service was absolutely top-notch 😉😎 The quality of the food was stellar and the presentation was delightful 😁
Tasty, but a bit pricey. Similar quality can be had all you can eat down the block, but definitely not similar innovation in the dishes!
Really good sushi! It's better than the average sushi place.
Its a solid B sushi place, but nothing extraordinary

Best sushi in Chicago hands down. The food is consistent and fresh every time I go. I have recommended this place to several friends and everyone who has tried it loved it! The staff is very friendly and attentive. I don’t bother going anywhere else for sushi.

The first step to  good sushi is good rice.  Their rice fell apart almost immediately with little to no flavor at all. The prices were fairly overpriced but I went with it initially hoping the food would match up in quality. It did not. The fish seemed subpar and was disguised on top a ridiculous plate in an attempt to make it look way better than it was. Don't be fooled, they may have great servers but the sushi is terrible.
Great sushi spot in Wicker Park.  Great service. Try the hamachi!

I’ve tried over a dozen sushi restaurants in the city and am yet to find one that tops Mirai. Hands down best sushi in Chicago. I had the Shrimp Tempura roll and it was fantastic. So good, in fact, that when asked what we’d like for dessert, we ordered another sushi roll. Service was also great. Fast, attentive, and friendly.
Everyone thinks they know the best sushi place but they don't. This is the best sushi
Best sushi in Wicker Park hands down. This is not your California roll and shrimp tempura type sushi place: it’s upscale and sophisticated. Scallop app is heavenly.
One of my favorite sushi spots in the Wicker Park area. Great menu, decor, and service!
Nice cozy location with great service
Amazing sushi like butter
Possibly the best sushi in Chicago
Sushi was pretty good but menu is very limited. The service was terrible though and the waiter was rude. Won't be returning.

What a gem!!! Not only is the food fantastic, but the service was one of a kind. When you ask for a dessert that's not on the menu, and the waiter appears with that exact dessert minutes later, all I can say is wow!!! They really go above and beyond here and make their customers feel so welcome!!!! You won't be disappointed!
Fresh and creative!
Shrimp Togarashi is the bomb!
Food is wonderful. Although a little tight and crowded for the seating
Mirai is a wonderful sushi restaurant
High quality fish. Always excellent sushi.
Always 5 star food and service!!
I was brought here on my birthday. The services was fantastic, the staff very helpful and the food... Superb. I will definitely be coming back for more.
my favorite sushi restaurant and not just because of the food. the servers are so accommodating and polite. love love this spot!
Very authentic. High quality. The fish are fresh. You know, it's hard to have such freshness seafood.
Every morsel was so good, some of the best sushi I have ever had. Sake offerings were wonderful.
Tuna tuna salmon, it's a phenomenon you can't miss out on.
Great selections.
Terrible service. The sushi was average at best. Part of our party did omakase but was disappointed. They confused the rest of the order.
AMAZEBALLS SUSHI!!  SIMPLY AMAZEBALLS. I don't know a lot about Suski but this place just ruined every Sushi  experience I've ever had.  Far and away the best I've ever had
Chicken Togarashi and white pillowy rice
Incredibly fresh fish! Nom Nom
Fresh. Fresh. Fresh.  We aren't near an ocean.

There's a reason Mirai has stayed open for so long--it's one of the best spots for sushi in Chicago, boasting authentic flavors, quality and consistency.  Sometimes, it's wise not to mess with a good thing--in the case of Mirai, it's definitely the menu (which hasn't changed in years).  While the decor is timeless in its modern minimalism, it could probably use a little face lift.  As with many of the area restaurants, the extra-wide sidewalks of Division Street allow for a more comfortable outdoor dining area.  I'm a fan of the new Streeterville location, and can't wait for the South Loop outpost to open.

I've been here twice - once on a romantic date with my husband and the second time for a dinner with a girlfriend. Both times I had a great experience!  The fish is very fresh and the drinks are creative and strong. For me, a good taste test for a sushi place is how good their sea urchin is - I made sure to ask the server how god it was and her response of "The chef will not put it out unless it's great." was satisfactory enough for me to give it a try.  Although a long shot from the sushi perfection of Ono Sushi in San Diego, CA, Mirai's urchin is very good. The rest of our rolls were pretty fantastic as well. But the sashimi deserves a special mention - I opted out for the middle of the price range fatty salmon, tuna and something else I can't remember, and all of the pieces were think and extremely fresh.  As for the drinks, my favorite cocktail here is the Lychee martini and that's what I get again and again - if you are a fan of slightly sweet, strong, fruity martinis, this it it.  Overall, I am very pleased with Mirai - the service is good, the sushi is fabulous, and the drinks are fantastic. It is pricey, but any good sushi place is.

The premier and elder statesmen of sushi joints in Wicker Park delivers on consistency. The rolls are good, but not great, and the service adequate. Its premier location are for a crowd that wants to be noticed and is will to pay for it. It's still probably among the better  sushi spots in the area.

It is  a bit pricey. However there is amazing ambiance, the second floor lounge makes this place amazing for a date on weekend. The cocktails are also very good. The patio is big enough and provides a comfortable distance between patrons.
Great Sushi! We frequently do the takeout and its just as high of quality. This is definitely the best sushi place in the city!
My fiance and I are foodies and when it comes to sushi we don't mess around. Time after time this place has proven to be the most fresh and simply sensational.

Can i give negative stars?  Food bad: tasteless and gritty.  service not present.  music beyond loud.  Basically: I was going to propose, but never wanted to return.  the end  (actually, not the end, i proposed 2 days later, she said yes, we're engaged.  And not returning to Mirai).
I can eat everyday here...they have the best sushi rolls around.
Amazing food!!!! Yes, it's crazy expensive, but totally worth it. Cocktails are just fabulous! Atmosphere is chic, but laid back.
Great cocktails, excellent akami nigiri, and the shrimp togarashi has an addictive sauce, and I highly this place.

If you go to Mirai you will not be disappointed and will most likely be making a return visit in the near future.  Sushi is very creative and incredibly delicious.  The atmosphere is great and drinks are awesome.  Great wine list as well.  Can be a bit more pricey than other sushi options in the city.

This place is overrated. Went there on a busy night, and ordered chicken, but they gave us shrimp. Also we ordered some rolls, and we repetitively ask the server if it's ready yet after like 20 mins, and the server responded "Oh, you guys didn't get it yet?" Obviously they forgot about it. Menu selection is so small. You pretty much just go there for its atmosphere, that's it.
By far the freshest sushi in Chicago. You can tell the difference on their sashimi, it hasn't been frozen. Get the sashimi combination plate, first rate!
Great quality of fish (same executive chef and suppliers as Japonais).

not your typical shopping mall sushi, mirai has the best ingredients prepared masterfully and with care. waiters have excellent suggestions and there is something for even the most squeamish of diners. every time, every time, i am in chicago mirai is on my itinerary.
